com.xith3d.spatial
Interface SpatialObjectInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
ColliderGeometry.SphereReference, Geometry
public interface SpatialObjectInterface

Defines the interface for all objects which can be checked into the various spatial trees.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2000-2002

Company: Teseract Software, LLP

Author:
David Yazel

Method Summary
 boolean getVertex(int i, javax.vecmath.Tuple3f pos)
          This allows the spatial container to have access to all the vertices in the object.
 int getVertexCount()
          Returns the number of vertices in this object.
 

Method Detail

getVertexCount

public int getVertexCount()
Returns the number of vertices in this object. This could be the number of vertices which form a convex hull or it could be the the total number of vertices in the object. If the object is a triangle then this would return a count of 3.

Returns:

getVertex

public boolean getVertex(int i,
                         javax.vecmath.Tuple3f pos)
This allows the spatial container to have access to all the vertices in the object. This allows for the computation of bounding boxes which completely enclose the bounding box. The vertices need to be returned in world coordinates, not local coordinates.

Parameters:
i -
pos -
Returns:
